Comment: It’s a slow trickle it more and more of the healthcare industry is realizing the old take of “fat bad - carbs good” was absolute garbage.  They saw cholesterol clogging arteries - so it’s absolutely understandable that the narrative they eating cholesterol is bad.     What we’ve realized is meat and fat is good, unprocessed or barely processed **whole grains**, and other carbs with a **low glycemic index**  are the carbs we need.  The issue has been sugars and processed carbs like white bread, white bread has a higher glycemic index than cane sugar. These foods are also calorie dense, so folks don’t feel full when they’ve had enough calories, so the body never gets the “ok, I’m full, stop eating” signal. And they’re addictive.    When we eat all those blood sugar spiking carbs, we develop body inflammation, which hits everything - and is now considered the precursor to cardiovascular diseases.
